abstract: Siemens reports first-quarter profit of 1.1 billion euros, or about $1.23 billion, down 25 percent from year-earlier period; cites slumping sales in energy industry.
lead_paragraph: The German engineering company said profit in its first quarter fell to $1.23 billion, and that it may have to cut jobs to reduce costs.
snippet: The German engineering company said profit in its first quarter fell to $1.23 billion, and that it may have to cut jobs to reduce costs.

headline.main: Siemens Profit Down 25% on Weak Economy and Lower Oil Prices
headline.print_headline: Fall in Energy Sector Sales Depresses Siemens Profit
